title: 107_s1134
content: The Act may be cited as the "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" and includes modifications applicable to qualified small business stock. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments such as repealing the minimum tax preference, increasing the rollover period for qualified small business stock to 180 days, and reducing the holding period for gains from certain small business stock to 3 years. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments like reducing the holding period for gains from certain small business stock to 3 years, repealing per-issuer limitations on eligible gain, and modifying rules related to qualified trade or business and working capital. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments such as increasing the exclusion for gain from certain small business stock to 100 percent and adding a waiver provision for stock purchases by corporations with a business purpose. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes various amendments to the tax code, such as increasing the exclusion for gain from certain small business stock to 100 percent and making changes to section 1202. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments to the tax code, such as changing the exclusion for gains from small business stock to 100 percent and expanding eligibility for larger businesses. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the asset limitation for qualified small businesses from $50,000,000 to $300,000,000. This adjustment is subject to inflation and rounded to the nearest multiple of $10,000. The amendments made by this section apply to stock issued after the enactment date of this Act.
